qas.question: At the start of the war, how many German troops were focused on the French frontier?
How many French troops were available to stand again the Germans?
What is the literal meaning of the Prussian word "Kreis?"
What did the French military numbers suffer from the most?

context: At the outset of the Franco-Prussian War, <a0_0>462,000<a0_0/> German soldiers concentrated on the French frontier while only <a1_0>270,000<a1_0/> French soldiers could be moved to face them, the French army <a3_0>having lost 100,000 stragglers<a3_0/> before a shot was fired through poor planning and administration. This was partly due to the peacetime organisations of the armies. Each Prussian Corps was based within a Kreis (<a2_0>literally "circle"<a2_0/>) around the chief city in an area. Reservists rarely lived more than a day's travel from their regiment's depot. By contrast, French regiments generally served far from their depots, which in turn were not in the areas of France from which their soldiers were drawn. Reservists often faced several days' journey to report to their depots, and then another long journey to join their regiments. Large numbers of reservists choked railway stations, vainly seeking rations and orders.
